meanings.definition: Inclined to talk excessively or indiscreetly.
meanings.sent1: She is so blabby during class, always chatting with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The blabby parrot wouldn't stop squawking all day.
meanings.sent3: The blabby squirrel chattered away, telling secrets to the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her blabby phone never stopped ringing, like a non-stop chatterbox.
meanings.sent5: The blabby stream of words from her mouth flowed endlessly.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive or indiscreet talk.
meanings.sent1: The blabby group of friends couldn't keep a secret if their lives depended on it.
meanings.sent2: His blabby behavior at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The blabby cat meowed loudly, sharing all the neighborhood gossip.
meanings.sent4: The blabby radio host filled the airwaves with non-stop chatter.
meanings.sent5: The blabby town crier announced the news with exaggerated flair.

meanings.definition: One who talks excessively or indiscreetly.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the blabby of the office, always sharing too much information.
meanings.sent2: The blabby in the group never knew when to stop talking.
meanings.sent3: The blabby at the party spilled all the secrets after one too many drinks.
meanings.sent4: The blabby on the bus wouldn't stop gossiping about everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The blabby in the library whispered loudly, disrupting the silence.
